dame_bs
  • tests package
  • View page source

tests package

It contains all the unit tests for core and utils functions.

tests.core_test module

Unit Tests for dame_bs core functions binary_search() and dame_with_binary_search()

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_interval_bounds()[source]

Confirm that the interval returned by binary search lies within [-1, 1].

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_interval_no_noise()[source]

Test binary search interval estimation with no noise (alpha = infinity). Checks that true mean lies within the estimated interval and the interval length has decreased.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_interval_shrinks()[source]

Test that the binary search confidence interval shrinks when number of users increases. Compares interval widths for smaller and larger n.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_invalid_alpha_type()[source]

Check that attempting_insertion_using_binary_search raises ValueError for negative alpha.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_invalid_delta_interval()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised if delta is >= 1.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_invalid_delta_not_positive()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised if delta is not a positive number less than 1.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_invalid_m_negative()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised if m is negative.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_invalid_m_not_int()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised when m is not a positive integer.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_invalid_n_type()[source]

Check that attempting_insertion_using_binary_search raises ValueError for negative n.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_mismatch_samples()[source]

Check that an error is raised if user_samples length does not match n.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_no_nan_inf()[source]

Test that the binary search interval does not contain NaN or infinite values.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_output_format()[source]

Test that attempting_insertion_using_binary_search returns an interval as a list of two floats.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_warns_and_corrects_odd_n()[source]

Check that a warning is issued when n is odd and corrected internally.

tests.core_test.test_binary_search_wrong_sample_length()[source]

Check that an error is raised if individual user samples do not have length m.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_invalid_alpha_type()[source]

Check that dame_with_binary_search raises ValueError for negative alpha.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_invalid_delta_interval()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised if delta is not a positive number less than 1.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_invalid_delta_negative()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised if delta is negative.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_invalid_m_negative()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised if m is negative.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_invalid_m_not_int()[source]

Check that ValueError is raised if m (number of samples per user) is not a positive inetger.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_invalid_n_type()[source]

Check that dame_with_binary_search raises ValueError for negative n.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_mismatch_samples()[source]

Check that an error is raised if user_samples length does not match n.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_no_noise()[source]

Test dame_with_binary_search output when noise is absent (alpha = infinity). Checks that estimated mean is within valid range and close to the true mean.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_output_range()[source]

Test that dame_with_binary_search returns a float estimate within the valid range [-1, 1].

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_warns_and_corrects_odd_n()[source]

Check that a warning is issued when n is odd and corrected internally.

tests.core_test.test_dame_with_binary_search_wrong_sample_length()[source]

Check that an error is raised if individual user samples do not have length m.

tests.utils_test module

tests.utils_test.test_error_decreases_with_higher_alpha()[source]

Ensures that emperical error reduces with higher alpha (lesser privacy)

tests.utils_test.test_error_decreases_with_more_users()[source]

Ensures that emperical error reduces with more users

tests.utils_test.test_estimate_within_error_and_bound(tol=0.1)[source]

Ensures that the DAME-BS empirical error is less than theoretical bound.

tests.utils_test.test_plot_errorbars_and_upper_bounds_runs(monkeypatch)[source]

Ensures the plotting function executes without crashing. Uses monkeypatch to suppress actual plot display.

tests.utils_test.test_run_dame_experiment_for_distributions()[source]

Runs the experiment using each supported distribution and asserts that errors are non-negative.

tests.utils_test.test_theoretical_bound_no_noise()[source]

Tests the edge case where alpha = ∞ (i.e., no added noise), and ensures the theoretical bound is reduced to its minimal form.

tests.utils_test.test_theoretical_upper_bound_valid()[source]

Verifies that theoretical_upper_bound returns a non-negative float.
